com.poesys.bs.delegate

Class AbstractDataDelegate<T extends IDto<S>,S extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto,K extends com.poesys.db.pk.IPrimaryKey>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.bs.delegate.AbstractDaoDelegate<S>
      • com.poesys.bs.delegate.AbstractDataDelegate<T,S,K>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the business layer DTO type
    S - the database layer DTO type
    K - the primary key type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDataDelegate<T,S,K>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractIdentityDataDelegate

    public abstract class AbstractDataDelegate<T extends IDto<S>,S extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto,K extends com.poesys.db.pk.IPrimaryKey>
extends AbstractDaoDelegate<S>
implements IDataDelegate<T,S,K>

    An abstract base class that implements the IDataDelegate interface for the business delegates in the application that require managed transactions in the database. The abstract class contains the specific methods for querying, inserting, updating, deleting, and truncating data in a class and its nested object classes.

    Business delegates should throw only DelegateException exceptions, so place all code that throws checked exceptions in try-catch blocks that handle the exceptions or throw a DelegateException with an appropriate message. The message should be translated if you are using a property from the I18N properties file by using the Message.getMessage() method.

    Each subclass must set the delegateName protected member with the class name of the delegate for error reporting.

    This version of Poesys/DB is a redesign that maintains the insert, update, and delete methods for backward compatibility but under the covers uses only the process method, centralizing delegate processing in that method to improve cohesion and maintainability. It also introduces the insert(object) and process(object) methods for single-object inserts.

    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

        Parameters:
        subsystem - the name of the subsystem
        dbms - the kind of database that implements the subsystem
        expiration - the cache expiration time in milliseconds for objects this delegate caches in a cache that supports object expiration

        protected abstract java.lang.String getClassName()
        Get the fully qualified class name of the IDto concrete subclass that this Data Delegate manages (type T). It has to be passed in because due to type erasure there is no way to get it from the generic parameter.

   return TestNatural.class.getName();
 }

      • wrapData

        protected abstract T wrapData(S dto)

        Wrap a Data Access Data Transfer Object (DTO) inside a Business DTO. This abstract method lets you call the appropriate constructor on the business DTO as part of the concrete implementation. Here is an example implementation using TestNatural and returning BsTestNatural: 

         
 @Override
 BsTestNatural wrapData(TestNatural dto) {
   return new BsTestNatural(dto);
 }
        Parameters:
        dto - the data access DTO
        Returns:
        the business DTO

      • doProcessing

        private void doProcessing(com.poesys.db.dao.PoesysTrackingThread thread)
        Process the list of DTOs using the appropriate DAOs. Throws a DelegateException with any batch-processing errors.
        Parameters:
        thread - the Poesys tracking thread for the transaction

      • postprocess

        protected void postprocess(java.util.Collection<S> dtos,
                           com.poesys.db.dao.PoesysTrackingThread thread)
        Post-process the DTOs by processing the nested objects within each DTO, inserting/updating/deleting them as required by their status. Mark each DTO as fully processed when the post-processing is complete to prevent further post-processing through subsequence DTOs. All processing happens within the existing tracking thread and hence within a single transaction.
        Parameters:
        dtos - the list of DTOs to process
        thread - the tracking thread

      • process

        public void process(T object)
             throws DelegateException
        Description copied from interface: IDataDelegate
        Process an object of type T in various statuses. The method inserts, updates, or deletes the object based on the status of the object, then processes all nested objects.
        Specified by:
        process in interface IDataDelegate<T extends IDto<S>,S extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto,K extends com.poesys.db.pk.IPrimaryKey>
        Parameters:
        object - the object of type T
        Throws:
        DelegateException - when there is a problem processing the objects

      • convertDtoList

        protected <R extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto> java.util.Collection<R> convertDtoList(java.util.List<T> list)
        Convert an input list of business-layer DTOs of type T to an output collection of type R. The implementation uses a thread-safe CopyOnWriteArrayList. This requires an unchecked up-cast to the type, so you should be sure the R type is a superclass of S.
        Type Parameters:
        R - R is an IDbDto that is a superclass of S or S itself, which permits you to convert a list of T objects to a list of S objects or to a list of superclass of S objects
        Parameters:
        list - the input DTO list
        Returns:
        a collection of type R (data-access transfer objects)

      • undoStatus

        protected <R extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto> void undoStatus(java.util.Collection<R> list)
        Helper method to undo the last status change for all the IDbDto objects in a collection that have EXISTS status. Use this after inserting a collection into a superclass table. Usually the collection comes from the conversion of the business-layer object list into a list of superclass objects (up-casting). The method does not undo NEW, DELETED, or CHANGED objects, just EXISTING, which are either just queried or just inserted. In the former case, undo does nothing; in the latter, it sets the status back to what it was before the insert happened (usually NEW).
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the object in the list (the superclass type)
        Parameters:
        list - a list of IDbDto objects
        See Also:
        convertDtoList(List)

      • finalizeStatus

        protected <R extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto> void finalizeStatus(java.util.Collection<R> dtos,
                                                                   com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto.Status status)
        Helper method to finalize the status for all the IDbDto objects in a collection that have a particular status. Use this after processing a collection and committing the operation to indicate that the status can no longer be undone.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the object in the list (the superclass type)
        Parameters:
        dtos - a collection of IDbDto objects
        status - a DTO status to finalize

      • updateChangedToExisting

        protected <R extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto> void updateChangedToExisting(java.util.Collection<R> dtos)
        Set all CHANGED DTOs in a collection to EXISTING status. You should call this method after updating a collection of DTOs.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the IDbDto type of the collection to update
        Parameters:
        dtos - a collection of DTO objects

      • truncateTable

        public void truncateTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                   throws DelegateException
        Description copied from interface: IDataDelegate
        Truncate a table, removing all rows. This is a Data Definition Language statement that will commit any open transaction. Note that you must have privileges to truncate the table in the underlying DBMS.
        Specified by:
        truncateTable in interface IDataDelegate<T extends IDto<S>,S extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto,K extends com.poesys.db.pk.IPrimaryKey>
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to truncate
        Throws:
        DelegateException - when there is a SQL exception on the attempt to truncate the table
